intro: Silene brevistaminea, commonly known as the short-stamined catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene brevistaminea is a rare species, often found in specific ecological niches, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
